entityname.Ankylosaurus_ltt:
Ankylosaurus
Click to select and then place an ankylosaurus, a heavily armored dinosaur with a large clubbed tail.
entityname.CowAuroch_ltt:
Aurochs
Click to select and then place an aurochs, an ancestor of many modern-day cattle breeds.
entityname.BearShortfaced_ltt:
Short-faced Bear
Click to select and then place a short-faced bear, the largest bear to have ever lived.
entityname.BirdElephant_ltt:
Elephant Bird
Click to select and then place an elephant bird, a giant fruit-eating bird that laid the largest eggs in the animal kingdom.
entityname.Bluebuck_ltt:
Bluebuck
Click to select and then place a Bluebuck, a recently extinct relative of the sable antelope and roan antelope.
entityname.CamelGiant_ltt:
Giant Camel
Click to select and then place a giant camel. One of the world's largest camels, they are also known by the name Titanotylopus.
entityname.CatSaberToothed_ltt:
Saber-Toothed Cat
Click to select and then place a saber-toothed cat, a predatory cat known for its two giant saberlike incisors and bob-tail.
entityname.DeerBushAntlered_ltt:
Bush-Antlered Deer
Click to select and then place a bush-antlered deer, also known as eucladoceros.
entityname.Deinonychus_ltt:
Deinonychus
Click to select and then place a deinonychus, a swift, agile, carnivorous dinosaur.
entityname.Deinosuchus_ltt:
Deinosuchus
Click to select and then place a deinosuchus, the world's largest known alligator.
entityname.Dimetrodon_ltt:
Dimetrodon
Click to select and then place a dimetrodon, an ancient reptile from before the time of the dinosaurs.
entityname.Diprotodon_ltt:
Diprotodon
Click to select and then place a Diprotodon, the largest marsupial to have ever lived.
entityname.Dodo_ltt:
Dodo
Click to select and then place a dodo, a peaceful frugivore that lived without fear of predators.
entityname.Doedicurus_ltt:
Doedicurus
Click to select and then place a Doedicurus, a giant relative of the armadillo with a spiked clublike tail.
entityname.ElephantDwarfSicilian_ltt:
Dwarf Sicilian Elephant
Click to select and then place a dwarf Sicilian elephant, one of the smallest elephants.
entityname.Gigantopithecus_ltt:
Gigantopithecus
Click to select and then place a Gigantopithecus, the largest ape that ever lived.
entityname.Kentrosaurus_ltt:
Kentrosaurus
Click to select and then place a kentrosaurus, a stegosaur known for their many of spikes.
entityname.LionCave_ltt:
Cave Lion
Click to select and then place a cave lion, the largest predatory cat that ever existed.
entityname.MastodonAmerican_ltt:
American Mastodon
Click to select and then place an American mastodon, a large boreal herbivore.
entityname.Protarchaeopteryx_ltt:
Protarchaeopteryx
Click to select and then place a protarchaeopteryx, the first feathered dinosaur discovered.
entityname.RhinocerosWooly_ltt:
Woolly Rhinoceros
Click to select and then place a woolly rhinoceros, an ancient relative of the Sumatran rhino.
entityname.Sivatherium_ltt:
Sivatherium
Click to select and then place a Sivatherium, an extinct member of the family Giraffidae with close family ties to the okapi.
entityname.SlothGroundGiant_ltt:
Giant Ground Sloth
Click to select and then place a giant ground sloth, a giant bipedal omnivore related to the modern ground sloth.
entityname.Stegosaurus_ltt:
Stegosaurus
Click to select, and then place a Stegosaurus, a dinosaur that used its bony plates to control its body temperature.
entityname.Stokesosaurus_ltt:
Stokesosaurus
Click to select, and then place a Stokesosaurus, a small tyrannosaur from the Jurassic Period.
entityname.Thylacine_ltt:
Thylacine
Click to select and then place a thylacine, a marsupial predator with the widest gape of any animal.
entityname.Utahraptor_ltt:
Utahraptor
Click to select and then place a utahraptor, a large carnivorous dinosaur that walked upright on its hind legs.
entityname.Velociraptor_ltt:
Velociraptor
Click to select and then place a velociraptor, a small, feathered raptor from the Cretaceous period.
entityname.Warrah_ltt:
Warrah
Click to select, and then place a Warrah, the only canid known to become extinct in modern historical times.
entityname.WarthogGiant_ltt:
Giant Warthog
Click to select and then place a giant warthog, one of the largest warthogs to have ever existed.
entityname.Quagga_ltt:
Quagga
Click to select and then place a quagga, a relative of the modern zebra.
entityname.PenguinKiller_ltt:
Killer Penguin
Click to select and then place a killer penguin. Careful, they can be dangerous to other animals!
entityname.SpringHare_ltt:
Spring Hare
Click to select and then place a spring hare. Careful, it's water soluble!
entityname.Squirrel_ltt:
Squirrel
Click to select and then place a squirrel. Careful, it's water soluble!
entityname.BullfrogGiant_ltt:
Giant Bullfrog
Click to select and then place a giant bullfrog. Careful, it's water soluble!
entityname.ButterflyMonarchGiant_ltt:
Giant Monarch Butterfly
Click to select and then place a giant monarch butterfly. Careful, it's water soluble!
entityname.Poop_BirdElephant_ltt:
Elephant Bird Poop
Click to select and then place elephant bird poop.
entityname.Poop_BirdElephant_Sick_ltt:
Elephant Bird Poop (Sick)
Click to select and then place elephant bird poop (sick).
entityname.Poop_Diprotodon_ltt:
Diprotodon Poop
Click to select and then place diprotodon poop.
entityname.Poop_Diprotodon_Sick_ltt:
Diprotodon Poop (Sick)
Click to select and then place diprotodon poop (sick).
entityname.Poop_Dodo_ltt:
Dodo Poop
Click to select and then place dodo poop.
entityname.Poop_Dodo_Sick_ltt:
Dodo Poop (Sick)
Click to select and then place dodo poop (sick).
entityname.Poop_Doedicurus_ltt:
Doedicurus Poop
Click to select and then place doedicurus poop.
entityname.Poop_Doedicurus_Sick_ltt:
Doedicurus Poop (Sick)
Click to select and then place doedicurus poop (sick).
entityname.Poop_SlothGroundGiant_ltt:
Giant Ground Sloth Poop
Click to select and then place giant ground sloth poop.
entityname.Poop_SlothGroundGiant_Sick_ltt:
Giant Ground Sloth Poop (Sick)
Click to select and then place giant ground sloth poop (sick).

entityname.AnkylosaurusNest_ltt:
Ankylosaurus Nest
Click to select and then place a ankylosaurus nest, where ankylosaurs lay their eggs.
entityname.DeinonychusNest_ltt:
Deinonychus Nest
Click to select and then place a deinonychus nest, where deinonychus lay their eggs.
entityname.KentrosaurusNest_ltt:
Kentrosaurus Nest
Click to select and then place a kentrosaurus nest, where kentrosaurs lay their eggs.
entityname.StegosaurusNest_ltt:
Stegosaurus Nest
Click to select and then place a stegosaurus nest, where stegosaurs lay their eggs.
entityname.StokesosaurusNest_ltt:
Stokesosaurus Nest
Click to select and then place a stokesosaurus nest, where stokesosaurs lay their eggs.
entityname.UtahraptorNest_ltt:
Utahraptor Nest
Click to select and then place a utahraptor nest, where utahraptors lay their eggs.
entityname.VelociraptorNest_ltt:
Velociraptor Nest
Click to select and then place a velociraptor nest, where velociraptors lay their eggs.
entityname.Terrain_Roots_ltt:
Roots
Click to select and then place roots, which are popular as a food source and a nesting material.
entityname.FoodDish_Roots_ltt:
Food Dish with Roots
Click to select, and then place the food dish with roots. Because it's small, food dishes need to be refilled often.
entityname.Trough_Roots_ltt:
Food Trough with Roots
Click to select and then place the food trough with roots. A food trough can accommodate up to six small animals at a time.
entityname.SubstratePile_Roots_ltt:
Substrate Pile with Roots
Click to select and then place a pile of forest bark and other organic materials mixed with roots. .
entityname.EntertainerExtinct_ltt:
Saber-Toothed Cat Entertainer
Click to hire the saber-toothed cat entertainer, a clever performer who entertains guests with small shows at stages.
entityname.EntertainerDinosaur_ltt:
Dinosaur Entertainer
Click to hire the dinosaur entertainer. Entertainers perform small shows at stages to entertain guests.
entityname.Paleontologist_ltt:
Paleontologist
Click to hire the paleontologist, who will help your zoo by finding fossils and educating your guests about extinct animal fossils.
entityname.DinoRecoveryTeam_ltt:
Dino Capture Team Agent
Click to hire the dino capture team agent, who will work as a group with other agents to recover dinosaurs that have escaped their exhibits.
entityname.DinoRecoveryRobot_ltt:
Dino Capture Team Robot
Click to hire the dino capture team robot, used by dino capture team agents as a decoy when dealing with dangerous dinosaurs. Made from organic materials safe for dinosaur consumption.
entityname.FossilDigPit_ltt:
Play Dig Pit
Click to select and then place the play dig pit. Guests get a chance to learn while digging in the dirt.
entityname.FossilEducationCenter_ltt:
Extinct Education Center
Click to select and then place the Extinct Education Center. Educators and paleontologists lecture here and guests help build extinct statues from bones they find at the play dig pit.
entityname.Statue_IrishElk_ltt:
Irish Elk Statue
Click to select and then place an Irish elk statue. Guests appreciate the beauty of a well-placed statue, especially one they helped create.
entityname.Statue_Mammoth_ltt:
Imperial Mammoth Statue
Click to select and then place an imperial mammoth statue. Guests appreciate the beauty of a well-placed statue, especially one they helped create.
entityname.Statue_TyrannosaurusRex_ltt:
Tyrannosaurus rex Statue
Click to select and then place a Tyrannosaurus rex statue. Guests appreciate the beauty of a well-placed statue, especially one they helped create.
entityname.Statue_Pteranodon_ltt:
Imperial Pteranodon Statue
Click to select and then place a pteranodon statue. Guests appreciate the beauty of a well-placed statue, especially one they helped create.
entityname.SizeMural_ltt:
Size Comparison Mural
Click to select and then place the size comparison mural. Guests are amused and educated by comparing their size to the size of these extinct animals.
entityname.bathroomlarge_xt_ltt:
Family Restroom
Click to select and then place the family restroom. They cost more than small restrooms, but accommodate up to six guests.
entityname.bathroomsmall_xt_ltt:
Small Restroom
Click to select and then place the small restroom, which accommodates one guest at a time.
entityname.snackcart_fruitcup_xt_ltt:
Fruit Cup Cart
Click to select and then place the fruit cup cart. Many guests enjoy fruit as a healthy snack.
entityname.snackcart_icecream_xt_ltt:
Ice Cream Cart
Click to select and then place the ice cream cart, a big favorite with young zoo guests.
entityname.snackcart_pretzel_xt_ltt:
Pretzel Cart
Click to select and then place the pretzel cart. Pretzels may make guests thirsty.
entityname.snackcart_cottoncandy_xt_ltt:
Cotton Candy Cart
Click to select and then place the cotton candy cart. Cotton candy is a classic kids' treat.
entityname.snackcart_cheesecake_xt_ltt:
Cheesecake Cart
Click to select and then place the cheesecake cart. Adult guests love cheesecake for dessert.
entityname.snackcart_popcorn_xt_ltt:
Popcorn Cart
Click to select and then place the popcorn cart. Popcorn is a filling snack that may make guests thirsty.
entityname.foodstand_coffee_xt_ltt:
Coffee Drink Stand
Click to select and then place the coffee drink stand. Adult guests love the caffeine jolt, and some younger guests are willing to try it, too.
entityname.foodstand_shishkabob_xt_ltt:
Shish Kebab Food Stand
Click to select and then place the shish kebab food stand, which offers protein-rich food at a reasonable price.
entityname.foodstand_hotdog_xt_ltt:
Hot Dog Food Stand
Click to select and then place the hot dog food stand. Especially popular with kids, hot dogs are a classic American food.
entityname.foodstand_burger_xt_ltt:
Hamburger Food Stand
Click to select and then place the hamburger food stand. Hamburgers are reasonably priced and reasonably filling.
entityname.foodstand_salad_xt_ltt:
Salad Food Stand
Click to select and then place the salad food stand. Kids usually don't like salads, but adults love them.
entityname.foodstand_soda_xt_ltt:
Soda Drink Stand
Click to select and then place the soda drink stand. Sodas are the most popular drink among most zoo guests.
entityname.foodstand_sub_xt_ltt:
Sub Food Stand
Click to select and then place the sub food stand. Subs are meat-filled sandwiches that are commonly devoured for lunch.
entityname.foodstand_sushi_xt_ltt:
Sushi Food Stand
Click to select and then place the sushi food stand. An expensive food choice, sushi is more popular with adults than kids.
entityname.foodstand_water_xt_ltt:
Water Drink Stand
Click to select and then place the water drink stand. Water satisfies your guests' most basic thirst needs.
entityname.giftcart_xt_ltt:
Extinct Gift Cart
Click to select and then place an Extinct gift cart, where guests can buy extinct animal souvenirs.
entityname.CloningCenter_ltt:
Extinct Research Lab
The Extinct Research Lab is the home base for extinct animals. You find fossils, assemble them, create extinct animals, and cure diseases here.
entityname.CavePaintingHall_ltt:
Cave Painting Hall
Click to select and then place the Cave Painting Hall, where guests see how animals were depicted thousands of years ago.
entityname.StageEntertainer_ltt:
Entertainer Stage
Click to select and then place the entertainer stage, where your costumed staff members delight and amuse guests.
entityname.DinoRecoveryBuilding_ltt:
Dino Capture Team Bunker
Click to select and then place the Dino Capture Team bunker. Topped with a decorative statue to keep it hidden from view, this building houses your elite dino-catching squad.
entityname.fossilmarker_ltt:
Flagged Fossil Site
Click to select and then place the Flagged Fossil Site. This dig site could contain extinct fossils!
entityname.DodoRock_ltt:
Dodo Rock
Click to select and then place a dodo rock, a rock that aids the dodo in digesting food.
entityname.ElephantLog_tiny_ltt:
Tiny Elephant Log
Click to select and then place a tiny elephant log, an enrichment item designed just for your dwarf Sicilian elephant.
entityname.Glacier_ltt:
Glacier
Click to select and then place a glacier. It pleases tundra, boreal, and alpine animals by making an exhibit colder.
entityname.MistyWaterfall_ltt:
Misty Spring
Click to select and then place a misty spring. It pleases your grassland, wetlands and tropical rainforest animals by making an exhibit warmer and more humid.
entityname.TarPit_ltt:
Tar Pit
Click to select and then place a tar pit. It pleases your desert, scrub and savannah animals by making an exhibit hotter.
entityname.AnimalBurrows_Grasslands_Large_ltt:
Grasslands Large Burrow
Click to select and then place a grasslands large burrow, which the Warrah and other grassland animals use for shelter.
entityname.LargeExtinctShelter_Shelter_ltt:
Rock Shelter
Click to select and then place a rock shelter, a very large shelter for very large animals.
entityname.Edelweiss_Alpine_ltt:
Edelweiss
Click to select and then place an edelweiss, a flower native to the Europe's alpine regions.
entityname.MonkeyPuzzleTree_Alpine_ltt:
Monkey Puzzle Tree
Click to select and then place a monkey puzzle tree, a large evergreen tree with razor-sharp leaves, often referred to as a living fossil.
entityname.Speargrass_Alpine_ltt:
Speargrass
Click to select and then place speargrass, an evergreen perennial with scented flowers native to New Zealand.
entityname.AgaveCactus_Desert_ltt:
Agave Cactus
Click to select and then place an agave cactus. Animals from the desert enjoy the agave cactus.
entityname.AloeVera_Desert_ltt:
Aloe Vera
Click to select and then place an aloe vera, a stemless desert plant with fleshy, serrated leaves and known for its use in herbal medicines.
entityname.SaguaroCactus_Desert_ltt:
Saguaro Cactus
Click to select and then place a saguaro cactus, a slow-growing endangered cactus native to Central and North America.
entityname.BoxElder_Grassland_ltt:
Boxelder
Click to select and then place a boxelder, a maple tree native to North America.
entityname.Daisies_Grassland_ltt:
Daisies
Click to select and then place daisies, a flower native to Europe and common to North America.
entityname.TallGoldenrod_Grassland_ltt:
Tall Goldenrod
Click to select and then place a tall goldenrod. Common to North America, it grows in woods and meadows, on hills, and even in rocky habitats.
entityname.DwarfAzalea_Tundra_ltt:
Dwarf Azalea
Click to select and then place a dwarf azalea, a hardy plant known for its many clusters of small flowers.
entityname.bench_xt_ltt:
Extinct Bench
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed bench. Guests enjoy visiting themed areas in your zoo.
entityname.DonationBox_xt_ltt:
Extinct Donation Box
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed donation box. Guests won't donate money if they can't find a donation box, so place them all over your zoo.
entityname.umbrellatable_xt_ltt:
Extinct Umbrella Table
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed umbrella table, which provides guests with a shaded place to rest and eat.
entityname.ViewingArea_xt_ltt:
Extinct Viewing Canopy
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed viewing canopy, which allows guests to view animals in shaded comfort.
entityname.lamp_xt_ltt:
Extinct Lamp Post
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed lamp post. Guests enjoy visiting themed areas in your zoo.
entityname.trashcan_xt_ltt:
Extinct Trash Can
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed trash can. Trash cans should be placed all over your zoo so that guests can dispose of their garbage.
entityname.Statue_xt_ltt:
Extinct Statue
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed statue. Guests appreciate the beauty of a well-placed statue.
entityname.PathArch_xt_ltt:
Extinct Arch
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed arch, which can be an attractive addition to paths or entrances to themed areas in your zoo.
entityname.Fountain_xt_ltt:
Extinct Decorative Tar Pit
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed decorative tar pit. Guests appreciate the beauty of well-placed decorative items.
entityname.MusicalRock_xt_ltt:
Extinct Music Rock
Click to select and then place an extinct-themed music rock, which plays music from speakers hidden inside of it.
entityname.Playground_BrachiosaurusSlide_ltt:
Brachiosaurus Slide
Click to select and then place a brachiosaurus slide, an enormous slide your young guests can play on.
entityname.highextinct_xt_ltt:
Extinct Fence
Click to select and then place sections of Extinct fence. Guests enjoy visiting themed areas in your zoo.
entityname.lowextinct_xt_ltt:
Low Extinct Fence
Click to select and then place sections of low Extinct fence. Guests enjoy visiting themed areas in your zoo.
entityname.extinctwindow_xt_ltt:
Extinct Window Fence
Click to select and then place sections of Extinct window fence. Guests enjoy visiting themed areas in your zoo.
entityname.electricfence_ltt:
Electric Fence
Click to select and then place sections of electric fence. A weak fence with a small electric charge to discourage animals from escaping.
entityname.path_extinct_xt_ltt:
Extinct Path
Click to select and then place sections of extinct-themed path. Guests enjoy visiting themed areas in your zoo.
entityname.Grenade_ltt:
Traquilization Grenade
This remote tranquilization device is used to make animals go to sleep.
entityname.Hotdog_Rubble_ltt:
Hotdog
Remnants of a food stand, animals will enjoy playing with and eatting the hotdog.
entityname.Rubble_Fragment_Wood_ltt:
Wood Fragment
Remnants of a wooden building, animals will enjoy playing with the rubble.
entityname.Rubble_Fragment_Concrete_ltt:
Concrete Fragment
Remnants of a concrete building, animals will enjoy playing with the rubble.
entityname.rubble_concrete_ltt:
Concrete Rubble
Remnants of a concrete building.
entityname.rubble_df_ltt:
Building Rubble
Remnants of a building.
entityname.rubble_end_ltt:
Endangered Themed Rubble
Remnants of a endangered themed building.
entityname.rubble_et_ltt:
Desert Themed Rubble
Remnants of a desert themed building.
entityname.rubble_jt_ltt:
Jungle Themed Rubble
Remnants of a jungle themed building.
entityname.rubble_st_ltt:
Safari Themed Rubble
Remnants of a safari themed building.
entityname.rubble_tt_ltt:
Tundra Themed Rubble
Remnants of a tundra themed building.
entityname.rubble_wood_ltt:
Wood Rubble
Remnants of a wood building.
entityname.rubble_xt_ltt:
Extinct Themed Rubble
Remnants of an extinct themed building.
entityname.rubble_InsectKiosk_ltt:
Destroyed Insect Kiosk
Pieces of a destroyed insect kiosk.
entityname.rubble_metal_ltt:
Destroyed Food Cart
Remnants of a destroyed food cart.
entityname.rubble_ReptileKiosk_ltt:
Destroyed Reptile Kiosk
Pieces of a destroyed reptile kiosk.
entityname.rubble_SizeMural_ltt:
Destroyed Size Comparison Mural
Remnants of an destroyed size comparison mural.
entityname.stump_ltt:
Tree Stump
A stump left over from a destroyed tree.
entityname.cactusstump_ltt:
Cactus Remains
Remains of a destroyed cactus.
entityname.Fossil_ltt:
Dig Pit Bone
Guests really like looking at the bone, their piece of a bigger puzzle.
entityname.CavemanClub_ltt:
Caveman Club
Guests who really liked the caveman buy this fun and safe replica of a club, made to the highest safety standards.
